Fairy

Level 38

+20 Plot Points

Languages

B’raeim (3), Dark-tongue (3), Fay (3), Old Nia (3), The Dead (3), Therion (3), & Choice (3)

Size: Tiny

Occupies: Less than 1x1x1.

Evanesce2

50 Stamina

Shift into the Essence Realm, making your physical body disappear and become untargetable.

While inside you gain Essence Sight and may use any abilities. In addition, you may choose which plane to enter (Essence, Change, Shadows, Stillness, etc). You may cancel this effect at any time.

Form Bond

5Min, 8SN, target must consent

Both you and a target you trust (in sight) will form a subconscious bond to one another and will share non-verbal communication, comprension, and compassion for one another that can be experienced at any distance. You understand each others’ thoughts and feelings. This is permanent until cancelled by either you or your target or one of you dies. If one of you dies, the survivor takes [4d6+12 SN] Damage. May only have one bond at a time.

Sentient Morph

16PT, 30SN, & 2 Plot Points

Become a flora or fauna of your choice & retain your sentience & abilities. Lasts until cancelled. See Non-Sentient/Sentient Morph in the Red Book.

Request Aid2

10PT & 1d6+6SN, Opt: +8PT, +1d6SN

Beckon a plant with a power of [4d20+250] at your feet in front of you. Must be standing on soil or plant matter. See Dismiss/Beckon Flora in the Red Book for more details.

Beckon Fauna: If [8PT] and [1d6SN] more was spent, an animal is beckoned to you instead and remains for [20min]. See Dismiss/Beckon Fauna in the Red Book.

Attack (No Attacks, see Request Aid)

Defense (See Abilities), 80 (=PT, Dodge)

Traversal2

75SN

Open a portal when you use Evanesce and any targets you are touching will enter the same plane that you do. Their physical bodies do not disappear and turn into essence (like yours) but rather they simply enter the plane in their physical body. When you leave, they do as well.

Visiting Soul

10min & 5 Plot Points

Target disembodied essence of an entity you trust is joined to a target object or entity permanently. The target that is to be joined to (if sentient) must consent and be within your sight. You must be touching the target disembodied essence (using Evanesce), they must spend 10 Plot Points, and they will lose Max Sanity equal to the Spell Resist of the thing they will be joined to. See Split/Join Essence in the Red Book.

~Passives~

Liminal, Moxie, Omniglot/Sublime Sway, Wholesomeness, Winged

Evaporate into essence upon death. Will revive if another Fay touches your essence or within 1d3 weeks. When you revive, you begin with Evanesce active at the current location of your essence.

May use Spell Resist against Social Spells.

May speak and listen to anything with full proficiency (from flora & fauna, to the living & dead). Can use Prestige maneuvers on all sentient things.

Give [+3d6+2] to target’s SN Regen. May only use once per day per target & only on targets you trust.

Can use Move in any direction and hold mid-air.

Willpower 80

Fiverent

Fiverent are a catch-all name given to the visually diverse looking species of giant serpents that live in Braven. Fiverent, put simply, look like immense snakes. They have many different patterns and markings, scale types (some are smooth, some have spiked scales or texture), eye colors, and head features (like horns, beards, or hoods). The land-dwelling fiverents tend to have smoother scales and features, while the water-dwelling fiverents have a coarser and hardier look to them, but this is not exclusive.

Venomous

Passive: 60 Nature* or 60 Alchemy

Analyze: 90 Nature

Their spit and bite are venomous. Their venom causes immense pain, blindness, and deafness.

Coldest Blooded

Passive: 70 Nature and 70 Alchemy

Analyze: 100 Nature

They blood-let to catch prey because being near their blood can cause a shivering paralysis.

Sun-Loving

Passive: 80 Nature

Analyze: 110 Nature

Fiverents can bask all day and sleep extremely deep when sunbathing. Steady bright light and heat cause them to get sleepy.

“Consuming each other for centuries, the fiverent’s pit is hell for us but heaven for them. ”

- Anonymous God, Shik-fal Scrolls

Behavior

Fiverent are the most aggressive predators anywhere they reside, even though they are fairly rare in maturity (which many denizens of Braven are surely thankful for).

As a predator they are proactive and will track, hunt, and directly attack their prey. They are territorial in the sense that they will attack and try to eat anything near their nest, but they do this for feeding purposes and not to defend their turf.

Habitat and Life

Fiverent live both on the land and at sea, favoring sunnier climates (although they have been spotted almost all across Braven, even in snowy climates). Due to their size, they are able to travel incredible distances and will sometimes leave their nest in search of a better hunting ground.

However, the most common area of Braven to find fiverents is the Southern edge of the Wasterly Desert, in a large canyon called the Snake, or Saanp ka Chhed. They have ample opportunies to prey on many different creatures of the desert that come to the nearby river for food.

Histories and Cultures

Cultures write about fiverents, but mostly in terms of disaster planning and emergency management. Unlike many other massive creatures, it appears that they are not treated with the same fascination.

Old annals of Elbus note that a large coalition actualy created the Saanp ka Chhed as an ideal location for fiverents so that they would avoid populated areas. Whether this is true is unknown.

Notes for Playing as

Fiverent can be treated as a huge disaster, menace to a city, or just a random encounter. Their simplicity is versatile!

Cannibalistic

Passive: 90 Nature

Analyze: 130 Nature

Nearly half of a fiverent’s diet is other fiverents. They will prefer snakelets to most all other meals.

Despise Dragons

Passive: 100 Nature

Analyze: 150 Nature

Dragons are a common predator both to snakelets and adults and are hated for this reason.

Cannot be Fooled

Passive: 110 Nature or 110 Essence

Analyze: 180 Nature

Fiverent are immune to illusions, social spells, social maneuvers, and anything that can alter the state of one’s mind, memories, or senses.

Fiverent Snakelet

Bite

10PT

Damage: [20 Health + 5d20+150 Stamina]

Info: Bite Attack (PU+CL), 6 Base PT

If target takes health damage and their [Toughness + 50] does not exceed your roll of [d100+65], they take [2d20 Sanity] Damage and have a 10% chance to lose sight and hearing for one round.

Let Blood

10PT & 20SN

Eviscerate your own flesh and take [25 Bleeding].

~Passives~

Inexorable, Neurotoxicity, Rapid Congealment, Water-loving

Immune to illusions, social spells, social maneuvers, and anything that can alter the state of your mind, memories, or senses.

As long as you have a wound or bleeding, you emit a neurotoxic vapor that causes violent shivering and paralysis. The radius of effect grows [10u] each round. All entities that breathe or have exposed flesh are affected and must use their [Toughness Total + 50] against your toxicity value of [4d20 + 65] every round they are within your radius. The first time they fail, their Move costs are doubled. The second: they take [5|100] more damage from all attacks. The third: they take [2d6] stun. The fourth: they take a Nervous wound (placed randomly using the Glance Table). The fifth: they are paralyzed. The first, second, and fifth effects last until they leave the radius.

Remove [5 Bleeding] every turn. If you have no bleeding to remove, heal one wound. If no wounds exist, your neurotoxicity stops. This benefit is active even after you perish.

Can hold your breath three times as long. Swimming costs normal Move.

Attack d100+140 (Bodily Attack)

Defense 160 (=PT, Dodge)

S. Resist 125, Lore Type: Nature

Move 10/6 INI 20 PT 20

Stam 2500 SN 100, +2 DH 220

Head

MIT 7 | 50%

Evade 0

Health 40

Body

MIT 7 | 50%

Evade -50

Health 200

Level 25

Draconic (1), The Sea (3), & Therion (3)

Occupies: 1x15x1 (1u wide, 15u long, 1u tall)

Fiverent Behemoth

Level 50

+8 Plot Points

Languages

Draconic (3), The Sea (3), & Therion (3)

Size: Colossal

Occupies: 4x70x4 (4u wide, 70u long, 4u tall).

~Passives~

2nd Wind I+II+III, Brawn, Competitive, Inexorable, Lgr. than Life, Neurotoxicity, Rapid Congealment, Size Adv/Disadv., Water-loving

Once per day when Stamina reaches below 9750, heal [50d20+1000 Stamina]. Once per day when Sanity reaches below 0, stay at 0. Once per day when Death Health reaches 0, heal [10d20 Health]

Double effects on the Trauma table.

Everyone after you in the INI order has 3PT less.

Immune to illusions, social spells, social maneuvers, and anything that can alter the state of your mind, memories, or senses.

As long as you have a wound or bleeding, you emit a neurotoxic vapor that causes violent shivering and paralysis. The radius of effect grows [10u] each round. All entities that breathe or have exposed flesh are affected and must use their [Toughness Total + 50] against your toxicity value of [4d20 + 250] every round they are within your radius. The first time they fail, their Move costs are doubled. The second: they take [5|500] more damage from all attacks. The third: they take [3d6] stun. The fourth: they take a Nervous wound (placed randomly using the Glance Table). The fifth: they are paralyzed. The first, second, and fifth effects last until they leave the radius.

Remove [7 Bleeding] every turn. If you have no bleeding to remove, heal one wound. If no wounds exist, your neurotoxicity stops. This benefit is active even after you perish.

Colossal: No attack roll is made. Instead, attacks have +3 Melee Range and may hit every unit up to that range. Attacks place randomly using glance table on each target occupying the unit unless targets use Block or are able to move from the unit.

Colossal: Cannot use defenses against physical attacks from Large-sized and smaller entities. Most moves cost significantly more PT.

Can hold your breath three times as long. Swimming costs normal Move.

Bite

17PT & 6SN, Optional: 2 Plot Points

Damage: [60 Health + 10d20+2100 Stamina]

Info: Bite Attack (ML+SL+CL), 6 Base PT

If target takes health damage and their [Toughness + 50] does not exceed your roll of [d100+250], they take [4d20 Sanity] Damage and have a 25% chance to lose sight and hearing for two rounds.

Optional: If [2 Plot Points] were spent (before the attack roll was made) and Bite hits or crits its target, it immediately strikes again with the same Attack Result (no roll or defense is made).

Coil2

20PT & 40SN

Coil into a defensive position for 3 rounds. Hiss at any target in sight in front of you (within 180 degrees) that moves towards you or attacks you. Hissing is an Intimidation Maneuver with a roll of [d100+150]. Cannot move while coiled.

Let Blood2

17PT & 20SN

Eviscerate your own flesh and take [35 Bleeding].

Spray Venom

Once per turn

Spray venom onto 5 entire units within a [60u] range, affecting all targets on each unit. Each unit must be touching at least one other. If each target’s [Toughness + 50] does not exceed your roll of [d100+250], they take [4d20 Sanity] Damage and have a 10% chance to lose sight and hearing for one round. If this strikes the head, then the chance to lose sight and hearing rises to 90%.

Attack (No Attack Rolls)

Fiverent Leviathan

Level 70

+18 Plot Points

Languages

Draconic (3), The Sea (3), & Therion (3)

Size: Medium

Occupies: 4x100x4 (4u wide, 100u long, 4u tall).

~Passives~

2nd Wind I+II+III, Brawn/Violent, Competitive, Inexorable, Neurotoxicity, Rapid Congealment, Size Adv/Disadv., Water-loving

Once per day when Stamina reaches below 16500, heal [70d20+1400 Stamina]. Once per day when Sanity reaches below 0, stay at 0. Once per day when Death Health reaches 0, heal [14d20 Health]

Triple effects on the Trauma table.

Everyone after you in the INI order has 3PT less.

Immune to illusions, social spells, social maneuvers, and anything that can alter the state of your mind, memories, or senses.

As long as you have a wound or bleeding, you emit a neurotoxic vapor that causes violent shivering and paralysis. The radius of effect grows [10u] each round. All entities that breathe or have exposed flesh are affected and must use their [Toughness Total + 50] against your toxicity value of [4d20 + 390] every round they are within your radius. The first time they fail, their Move costs are doubled. The second: they take [5|500] more damage from all attacks. The third: they take [3d6] stun. The fourth: they take a Nervous wound (placed randomly using the Glance Table). The fifth: they are paralyzed. The first, second, and fifth effects last until they leave the radius.

Remove [10 Bleeding] every turn. If you have no bleeding to remove, heal one wound. If no wounds exist, your neurotoxicity stops. This benefit is active even after you perish.

Colossal: No attack roll is made. Instead, attacks have +3 Melee Range and may hit every unit up to that range. Attacks place randomly using glance table on each target occupying the unit unless targets use Block or are able to move from the unit.

Colossal: Cannot use defenses against physical attacks from Large-sized and smaller entities. Most moves cost significantly more PT.

Can hold your breath three times as long. Swimming costs normal Move.

Bite

18PT & 6SN, Optional: 2 Plot Points

Damage: [88 Health + 10d20+2100 Stamina]

Info: Bite Attack (ML+SL+CL), 6 Base PT

If target takes health damage and their [Toughness + 50] does not exceed your roll of [d100+390], they take [6d20 Sanity] Damage and have a 25% chance to lose sight and hearing for two rounds.

Optional: If [2 Plot Points] were spent (before the attack roll was made) and Bite hits or crits its target, it immediately strikes again with the same Attack Result (no roll or defense is made).

Constrict

9 Plot Points

Wrap yourself around a craft or entity of any size for 3 rounds with a strength of [1025]. Deal [4100 Stamina] Damage each round (no trauma or MIT). If target is a craft, it is destroyed at the end of round 3. You cannot move while using Constrict.

Spray venom onto 7 entire units within a [60u] range, affecting all targets on each unit. Each unit must be touching at least one other. If each target’s [Toughness + 50] does not exceed your roll of [d100+390], they take [6d20 Sanity] Damage and have a 10% chance to lose sight and hearing for one round. Gollard Nymphs

Gollards’ bodies are technically pure essence, but contain so much that they have physically manifested. Gremlins are around the size of dwarves while hobs can be as large as a titanborn. They have perfectly round heads with two long antennae and several whiskers, no eyes or ears, a wide, shining, toothy smile, and four lanky limbs, each with long-fingered, clawed hands. The surface of their bodies can change to any color along a grayscale (from white to black) with an iridescent shimmer of random color when seen from the right angle. They move fluidly but erratically, as if both graceful and drunk.

Hoarders

Passive: 10 Essence or 20 Common

Analyze: 40 Essence

Gollard lairs are full of treasures and they will protect their turf with their lives.

Impulsive Disasters

Passive: 20 Essence*

Analyze: 50 Essence

Gollards can reroll their INI every round but are very clumsy (have a high fumble chance).

Tricky

Passive: 30 Essence and 30 Alchemy

Analyze: 60 Essence

Gollards are clever and may use one of their own as bait, blend in with their surroundings, or even lie in ambush by hiding within an item.

“They are essentially the waste of planes, trash that has spilled out into our world. Vile things.”

- E.R. Dyan, The Cosmic Drama: Demons, Dragons, Dieties

Behavior

Gollards will generally use all fours for locomotion but will sometimes move upright as well. When standing still, they favor being upright.

Gollards are well known first and foremost for murdering and looting travelers. While they do practice residential burglary, they will avoid breaking into homes if the neighborhood appears poor (why exactly is up for debate). Since they don’t travel far into cities, this creates an interesting situation where their second most common activity is robbing wealthy suburbanites.

Habitat and Life

Gollards are a product of The Seep, a rift between the Plane of Change and the Plane of Shadows. They spill out into the Realm of Forms (our world) whenever The Seep’s energy overflows.

As far as scholars can surmise, Gollards seem to enjoy living in the Realm of Forms. They are not born or conceived but rather come into being through this violent collision between planes in the Essence Realm. They seem to be unaware of their origins (or simply do not care).

Histories and Cultures

While comical to witness, Gollards are generally considered a terror to deal with. They have no regard for life (and may not even understand it).

Because of this, gollards are listed in several travel manuals as the #1 cause of death for new adventurers and people visiting other cities taking roads less traveled. Gollards are a regular source of pain for the wealthy, suburban, merchant class.

Notes for Playing as

Gollards can be a great early “kill the baddies” quest and even as a surprise (if they start popping out of items). Make them absurd!

Otherly Senses

Passive: 40 Essence

Analyze: 70 Essence

Gollards don’t need eyes or ears to sense things.

Close to Magic

Passive: 50 Essence

Analyze: 100 Essence

Gollards are extremely weak to magic but will sometimes reflect spells back at their caster.

Drawn to Rifts in Time

Passive: 200 Essence

Analyze: 270 Essence

Gollards propogate much faster near chronocules and will seek them out, especially if no Kelpie is nearby. (However due to the incredible rarity of chronocules, this is still quite unheard of.)

Gremlin

Scratch

3PT, Free once per turn

Damage: [4 Health + 1d20+45 Stamina]

Info: H2H Attack (SL), 3 Base PT

Slink2

10SN, Optional: 1 Plot Point

You camouflage your skin, gaining [+5d20] Stealth and to your next Dodge and gain Essence Sight. Stealth and Sight bonuses last for 3 minutes.

Optional: If [1 Plot Point] was spent, you may hide yourself within an item you are touching. This makes your physical body disappear, so you will only be detectable through spells. This effect and the Essence Sight last until cancelled. When cancelled, you appear within [1u] of the item.

~Passives~

10% chance to reflect any spell cast on you.

You are immune to visual and hearing negatives.

You fumble on a roll between 1-15 but may reroll your INI once per round (if you want). Any limb can be used to attack.

Each attack targets the Chest and places randomly (using the Glance Table). Only one attack roll is made for both strikes. If both strikes deal health damage, the SN cost of this move is refunded. This requires at least two limbs to use, otherwise costs are halved, only one attack is made, and SN cannot be refunded.

You camouflage your skin, gaining [+5d20] Stealth and to your next Dodge and gain Essence Sight. Stealth and Sight bonuses last for 3 minutes.

Optional: If [1 Plot Point] was spent, you may hide yourself within an item you are touching. This makes your physical body disappear, so you will only be detectable through spells. This effect and the Essence Sight last until cancelled. When cancelled, you appear within [1u] of the item.

Grenoren

Grenoren are huge birds of prey resembling all manner of owls. They have piercing, dark eyes that brightly shine yellow if their gaze is met directly. They can lash out with their curved beaks as fast as a pit viper and turn their head 180 degrees with frightening speed. Their vocal chords are longer and looser when they are young, giving them a deep but gentle voice. But as adults, their voice is higher in pitch and much stronger. A grenoren’s head is constantly pivoting as they scan their surroundings.

Reasonable

Passive: 50 Nature*

Analyze: 80 Nature

Grenoren are rational creatures (even if not domesticated) and don’t often prey on humans.

Full of Gossip

Passive: 60 Nature or 80 Common

Analyze: 90 Nature

Grenoren keep track of all kinds of news in the area they inhabit and might even know secrets.

Powerfully Lucky

Passive: 70 Nature & 70 Essence

Analyze: 100 Nature

Grenoren are surrounded by good fortune and are incredibly difficult to fight or capture. They use their luck to their advantage. Beware.

“Full of good humor, always ready to tell a tale. Who doesn’t love the company of a grenoren?”

- Eoghan Scrivener, On Creatures

Behavior

Grenoren act fairly agreeable most of the time and typically enjoy the company of humanoids for their shared wit. Grenoren are observant, kind, and love to tease adventurers. If encountered and they are not busy hunting or otherwise preoccupied, Grenoren love to gossip.

Grenoren are quite nocturnal and can be sleepy and irritable if bothered during daylight, while quite cheery and full of wit during the night.

Habitat and Life

Grenoren live in all different climates, from deserts to mountaintops and are known to hunt virtually everything smaller than themselves. Despite this, it appears that grenoren often favor humans, perhaps for their intelligence or humor, and will only hunt them if completely desperate.

Grenoren may have several mates through their lifetimes and always devote themselves as dutiful parents if they produce offspring. They build their nests high off the ground and hard to reach (and therefore safer for their chicks). Grenoren fledglings are able to fly, unlike most all winged beasts.

Histories and Cultures

Nearly every culture has something written about Grenoren, typically about their kindness and sharp wit. Some cultures revere the Grenoren as lucky, while in others they are feared as badly as demons.

Older records note a time when grenoren lived more closely in harmony with humans, even sharing meals. But whether or not those legends are true, something changed this long ago.

Notes for Playing as

Grenoren should be more than a mere beast to fight. Think of them more as complex characters, guides, or even eventual allies to your players.

All-seeing

Passive: 80 Nature

Analyze: 110 Nature

This keen creature has no blind spot and will know your level, stats, arts, defenses, abilities, and PT.

Blessed

Passive: 100 Nature & 100 Essence

Analyze: 150 Nature

Grenoren are capable of granting some of their powerful luck to those they trust and favor.

Trans-planar Conduit

Passive: 150 Nature & 150 Essence

Analyze: 220 Nature

Grenoren can summon as well as listen and speak telepathically to any target they have blessed, even across different planes or realms of existence.

Grenoren Fledgling

Dive

10SN & 100Stam, Opt: 4 Plot Points

Immediately fly down and strike a target beneath you. This must be used with Lacerate. You add [1 Health] to Lacerate’s damage for every unit you are above your target before using Dive. If [4 Plot Points] were spent, you return to the position you started in before using Dive and avoid any Opportunity Attacks due to your movement.

Fly Up2

8SN per Move, Optional: 1 Plot Point

Can use Move out of turn if flying straight up. If [1 Plot Point] was spent, Move costs [0 PT].

Lacerate

Grenoren

Level 36

+36 Plot Points

Languages

Therion (3), Colonial (3), & Choice (3)

Size: Huge

Occupies: 3x3x6 (3u wide, 3u deep, 6u tall).

Barrel Roll2

3 Plot Points

[+115] to your next Dodge and remove all from your back. Must be in the air when using this.

Bless2

4 Plot Points

Give a close, trusted friend one of your favorite down feathers. Target gains [2 Plot Points]. This may only be done once per target.

4 Plot Points, Optional: Free to use

Summon a friend you have blessed previously to your side. Friend may be in any place or timespace but must consent (See Tight Bond passive).

Optional: If your friend spends the [2 Plot Points] you blessed them with, this has no cost to you.

Dive

10SN & 100Stam, Opt: 4 Plot Points

Immediately fly down up to [50u] and strike a target beneath you. This must be used with Lacerate. You add [1 Health] to Lacerate’s damage for every unit you are above your target before using Dive. If [4 Plot Points] were spent, you return to the position you started in before using Dive and avoid any Opportunity Attacks due to your movement.

Pluck

12PT, Optional: 6 Plot Points

Pick up target using your talons. Must be in the air when using this. Grapple strength and WE limit is [120]. Target may use Struggle.

Drop: At any point and for free, your target may be dropped. Falling damage may apply.

Optional: If [6 Plot Points] were spent, no roll is needed to hit target and strength and WE limit is increased to [180].

~Passives~

Tight Bond, Perfect Insight, Size Advantage, Size Disadvantage, Winged

Can listen and speak telepathically to any friend you have blessed. Unlimited range and duration.

Can see 360 degrees. Know all targets’ MIT, Stats, Arts, Vitality, Move, Evade, PT, Gifts, and Level.

Huge: Attacks have +1 Melee Range.

Huge: Cannot use defenses against physical attacks from Small-sized and smaller entities. Most moves cost much more PT.

Can use Move in any direction and hold mid-air.

Arm Muscle 60

Leg Muscle 60

*Erudition 80

Alchemy Lore 120

Common Lore 120

Essence Lore 120

Wits 70

Awareness 130

Craftiness 110

Inscription 90

Tactics 115

Prestige 45

Authority 50

Charisma 90

Nerve 30

Courage 70

Willpower 90

Grolls

Grolls are looming, grotesque, tree-like creatures that are painted with patches of moss, speckled with bright fungal growth, blanketed in ferns and vines, and twisted under curled branches and gnarled knots of wood. They typically hunch over, but stand as tall as a high understory tree if they straighten themselves. Grolls have a lanky, hunched, bi-pedal form that is concealed beneath all the flora that has fused with their body. Grolls make low, creaking sounds like old oaks in heavy winds or the rolling of pines. When they move (if they move) it is with a slow, swinging saunter.

Stay Awake

Passive: 30 Nature or 40 Common

Analyze: 60 Nature

Being in Groll territory can cause Grollsickness, which can make you so exhausted you collapse.

Get Good Sleep

Passive: 70 Nature or 80 Common

Analyze: 100 Nature

Anyone who gets poor sleep or who loses too much Stamina during the day is at risk of being affected by grollsickness. Good sleep is prevention.

Hedonistic

Passive: 80 Nature

Analyze: 110 Nature

Grolls assimilate dreams because they enjoy it. They do not need to in order to survive.

“Chapter 9: Pheromones and Nihilism, or why the Dream Eaters are good for science, actually.”

- Ri Richus, Alchemy

Behavior

Grolls are difficult to categorize from a behavioral standpoint. They appear mostly to sit or lie about, gently absorbing nutrients from the soil, sun, and nearby plant matter. Their pheromones (which are invisible to the naked eye and have no scent to humans) add greatly to their mood swings and behavior.

Every groll that has been visually observed by researchers moves at an unbelievably slow pace.

Habitat and Life

Grolls can inhabit any environment that supports tree propogation, even with sparse flora (like Setrocania). However, they avoid getting too close to coastlines, too high in the mountains, and too close to deserts. Why exactly is unknown.

Groll reproduce by a propogation method where they split off part of their body and plant it in the ground. For a period as short as one year or as long as five decades, this propogation will be identical to plant matter. Eventually, the propogation gains sentience and uproots.

Grolls never share territory and will detect another’s pheromones and move away if too close.

Histories and Cultures

Grolls are discussed in almost every culture, especially because most border the woods of The Deep.

Some understand that the groll serves an important role in most environments, keeping underbrush, overgrowth, and invasive species at bay.

Even so, they are widely regarded as dangerous.

Notes for Playing as

A groll should be a multi-day encounter. Slowly whittle your players down and then suddenly strike if one is low on Stamina. Be horrifying!

Do not Trepidate

Passive: 90 Nature*

Analyze: 140 Nature

Grolls only reveal themselves if someone has grollsickness and is very low on Stamina.

Rapacious

Passive: 120 Nature or 120 Alchemy

Analyze: 170 Nature

Grolls move quickly when they are unseen and can sense using their pheromone cloud.

Perennial

Passive: 150 Nature & 150 Alchemy

Analyze: 200 Nature

All grolls turn into trees when they die. However, elder grolls can also die prematurely in order to be regenerated after a short time. Tricky!

Groll Sapling

Level 25

+3 Plot Points

Languages

B’raeim (3), Groll (3), & Therion (1)

Occupies: 2x2x10 (2u wide, 2u deep, 10u tall).

Stam 2700 SN 300, +5 DH 185

R Leg

Evade -50

Health 240

Chest

MIT 5 | 10%

Evade -50

Health 330

L Arm

Assimilate Dreams

6PT & 10SN

Damage: [4d6+4 Health + 3d20 Sanity]

Info: Melee Range Psychic Attack (DI), 6 Base PT

Consume sleeping or unconscious target’s dreams. Gain [1 Plot Point] if target receives a head wound, dies, or their Sanity reaches 0 due to this attack.

Squash

12PT & 100 Stamina

Damage: [6d20+600 Stamina]

Info: H2H Attack (SM), 6 Base PT

~Passives~

Coy Instincts, Pheromonal Nervous System, Size Adv/Disadv., Wooden

Move increased to [10/2] as long as you’re unseen.

Detect all entities in a [1000u] radius. Gain [+70] Awareness against Stealth. You know the Stamina of all in the radius. For every 2 hours an entity remains in your radius, they lose [d100+100 Stamina]. Any affected entity that drops below 50% Stamina or fails a Sleep check gains Grollsickness and cannot sleep for 48 hours. Entities may resist your pheromones if their [Willpower or Toughness + 50] exceed your value of [170].

Huge: Attacks have +1 Melee Range.

Huge: Cannot use defenses against physical attacks from Small-sized and smaller entities. Most moves cost much more PT.

Take +100% damage from Fire and Chop attacks.

Old Growth Groll

Level 45

+10 Plot Points

Languages

Assimilate Dreams

6PT & 20SN

Damage: [8d6+48 Health + 6d20 Sanity]

Info: Melee Range Psychic Attack (DI), 6 Base PT

Consume sleeping or unconscious target’s dreams. Gain [1 Plot Point] if target receives a head wound, dies, or their Sanity reaches 0 due to this attack.

Feign Death2

50SN & 8 Plot Points

Reduce your Death Health to 0 and die after 1 turn. If you die due to this ability, you may revive yourself at any location within range of your pheromones as long as there is a suitable tree present for you to fuse your nervous system to. Your Sanity remains as it was when you revive.

Roil in Vines2

12PT

Deconstruct yourself into a large, writhing pile of vines, making yourself untargetable by and immune to physical attacks. Move is increased to [15/2]. All attacks you receive strike your chest. You take quadruple damage from fire in this form (instead of double), your Squash move deals half damage, and you cannot Assimilate Dreams. This form may be cancelled by spending 6PT.

Tend Flora

18PT & 15SN

You mold, graft, combine, or create various flora of choice using other bits of nearby flora.

Doing this greatly heals the plant matter, if grafting or combining one plant with another. This heals [4d20+40 Health] to Death and [2d20+20] on location. Heals all wounds if Limb becomes fully healed. You may use this on yourself.

~Passives~

Coy Instincts, Hardened Sap, Old Growth/Size Adv, Pheromonal Nervous System, Rigor Mortis, Size Disadv

Move increased to [15/2] as long as you’re unseen.

Immune to bleeding.

Huge: Attacks have +2 Melee Range. You take +100% damage from Fire and Chop attacks. You are immune to all diseases and poisons.

Detect all entities in a [2500u] radius. Gain [+125] Awareness against Stealth. You know the Stamina of all in the radius. For every 2 hours an entity remains in your radius, they lose [d100+250 Stamina]. Any affected entity that drops below 50% Stamina or fails a Sleep check gains Grollsickness and cannot sleep for 48 hours. Entities may resist your pheromones if their [Willpower or Toughness + 50] exceed your value of [250].

When you die, your body becomes like an ordinary tree and cannot be fused with by any groll that feigns their death.

Huge: Cannot use defenses against physical attacks from Small-sized and smaller entities. Most moves cost much more PT.

Koda

Koda are beasts larger and wider than a grizzly bear, with a similar appearance. Their head, eyes, ears, and gait all resemble a bear’s, but they are their own species (often mistakenly called “koda bears”). They have an incredibly dense coat of short, fine hairs and carry a strong scent of oil, which can be seen glistening on their fur. They are black, brown, reddish brown, or tan in color, with a distinct white stripe on either side of their body, running from their mouth to their ribs, ending in a wide spiral.

Friendly, yet Wise

Passive: 20 Nature* or 30 Common

Analyze: 50 Nature

Koda assume the best in others but are not fools.

Variable Immunity

Passive: 30 Nature or 40 Alchemy

Analyze: 60 Nature

Koda take half damage from the last three unique attack types to deal damage to them. This means you must have a variety of attacks to fight them.

Vigorous Breath

Passive: 40 Nature or 60 Essence

Analyze: 70 Nature

Koda breathe so deeply that they can capture the strength of their environment. This heals them and anyone they exhale onto.

“If an enemy the koda does dare, then it too should you beware. (Trust their choice in what is evil.)”

- Anonymous God, Shik-fal Scrolls

Behavior

Koda have a range of behaviors, from determined and ambitious, to open-minded and peaceful. Much of a koda’s behavior can be attributed to the values they were given when they were reared, their environment, and their personal drives.

Koda are relatively intelligent and well-spoken. They are famously agreeable but will avoid anything resembling a formal promise, debt, contract, or service. Koda often give and expect nothing in return and expect the same relationship with others when they are aided.

Habitat and Life

Koda tend to favor temperate to cold climates, avoiding dry and highly populated areas.

They eat a sustainable spread based on the environment they live in which can range from a primarily plant-based diet to an omnivorous one.

Koda often live in pairs, either as friends or mates. They may have many partners during their lifetime but tend to only stay together long-term if they have cubs. Cubs leave their parents at a fairly young age, often also in pairs for their first few years. Parents may separate once their cubs leave, in search of new friends or mates.

Histories and Cultures

Many cultures write about the noble and autonomous koda, whose selfless labors have helped close many chapters of history in favor of humanity.

Koda have a secret oral history devoted to rooting out evil shapeshifters (their Quest). Despite this, most koda have never actually seen a shapeshifter.

Notes for Playing as

Koda on The Quest don’t need to be singular, zealous, or driven. They are often patient and open to “side-quests” (if you will). They like people!

Impervious

Passive: 60 Nature or 80 Essence

Analyze: 90 Nature

Koda are immune to intimidation and illusions.

Honorable

Passive: 80 Nature and 100 Common

Analyze: 130 Nature

Some adult Koda join The Quest, a secret order of adventuring saints. Koda on The Quest will not tolerate liars, thieves, murderers, or rapists.

Foe of the Ageless Ones

Passive: 200 Nature or 200 Alchemy

Analyze: 270 Nature

Koda are the only thing capable of recognizing a shifted zamycleus and are immune to their two-face paralysis. Their Quest is to destroy them all.

Koda Cub

6PT & 7SN, Optional: +3PT

Breathe in so intensely that you congeal the essence in the air into a restorative mist. You heal [d100+30 Stamina] and stop [5 Bleeding].

Optional: If [+3PT] more was spent, you may also heal a target within [1u] range the same amount.

Prime Trait

Once per day

Physique: Max and double all dice rolled for damage on an attack of choice.

Damage: [d6+1 Health + 2d20+75 Stamina]

Info: Bodily Attack (SL or PU), 4 Base PT

~Passives~

Bullish, Impervious, Transdermis

Cannot be stunned.

Immune to Intimidate and magical illusions. You can also spot a zamycleus when shape-shifted.

Your skin and fur rapidly adapts. You take half damage from the last three attack types which dealt damage to you. Defaults to SL, PU, and SM.

Korl

Korl are huge, gender neutral entities with many long arms and multiple heads facing different directions. Their bodies have three chests facing outward with no back, shaped like a triangular funnel. Korl are always adorned in swirling, deep blue colored armor with a weapon in each hand. They have no lower body and are fused to the surface they inhabit (which can even be upside-down or horizontal). They have cool grey to nearly white skin and intense, glowing white eyes. If one body holds perfectly still and closes its eyes, that body’s weapons matches their skin tone and they appear like a statue.

Guarding Something

Passive: 40 Essence & 40 Common

Analyze: 70 Essence

This thing appears to be placed here, as if it is supposed to be guarding something.

That Statue... is Bad

Passive: 50 Essence or 60 Alchemy

Analyze: 80 Essence

You can feel energy emanating off of this “statue.” Plus, the surface is definitely not stone.

Liquidity

Passive: 60 Essence & 60 Alchemy

Analyze: 110 Essence

Despite their stony appearance, strong korl can change their form (or parts of it) into water to avoid attacks, move, or even hide.

“Cosmologically, the korl is quite important. But if brought here? Guard duty, it seems.”

- Yis’rit Vautbaum, Theologies and Philosophies of Nature

Behavior

Korl almost never speak or make noise vocally and show practically no facial expression, making them difficult to judge. They don’t display kindness or contempt but rather a complete lack of feeling or emotion. They’ll often lie in wait with one head’s eyes closed until someone walks close enough to see their second or third head.

While they don’t seem to be especially interested in killing, they are viciously aggressive when anything comes near (as if compelled to do so).

If somehow the spell that conjured a korl is broken or reversed, they will change their stony attitude and become gregarious, vocal, and friendly.

Habitat and Life

Korl do not eat, drink, sleep, age, reproduce, migrate, or otherwise have markers of habits of their own. They are used to guard things.

Histories and Cultures

Long ago, before conjuring beings was considered illegal (before magic was even regulated at all) the korl were often employed to guard important areas, treasures, and even key choke points in a battle.

Statues made to look like korl standing guard are vestiges of these old times, when just their appearance could ward off would-be villains and heroes.

While written histories note the korl’s importance, the details that they were conjured have been wiped from all records. With the advent of the rune licensure process, it was deemed that conjuring beings is often cruel and done without the being’s consent. The magisterium hid the truth.

Notes for Playing as

Perhaps the korl is just an obstacle to kill in a dungeon. But if your players are compassionate, they might gain an ally (or at least special loot)!

Limited Space

Passive: 80 Essence*

Analyze: 130 Essence

Korl cannot travel too far from their location.

They’ve Been Conjured

Passive: 90 Essence

Analyze: 140 Essence

Korl are from the Essence Realm at the intersection of the Plane of Change and the Plane of Stillness. They are not likely here on their own will.

They May Give Gifts

Passive: 100 Essence or 120 Alchemy

Analyze: 170 Essence

Old legends say that the most powerful and rare of korl can grant gifts. These ones use no shields. Perhaps there is a way to get on their good side...

Korl Sentinel

Appear as a statue if standing still, eyes closed. You revive and regenerate fully every 6 hours.

Huge: Attacks have +1 Melee Range.

Huge: Cannot use defenses against physical attacks from Small-sized and smaller entities.

Can see +120 degrees per head. Gain an Opportunity if an opponent moves into melee range. Can use Shoot as an Opportunity if hit by a ranged attack. 1 Opportunity per turn per head.

Immune to Fire, take +100% damage from Shock, and double Trauma Effects from Cold.

Korl Steward

Level 28

+5 Plot Points

Languages

Dark-Tongue (3), Old Nia (3), The Sea (3), & Choice (2)

Size: Huge

Occupies: 4x4x4 (4u wide, 4u deep, 4u tall).

Aquamorph2

3, 4, or 12PT

For just a mere moment, melt a specified body part into water as a Dodge Maneuver with a value of [175]. If unobstructed, your body part returns to normal immediately after using this ability, (if something is obstructing your body part, it may remain watery until the obstruction is removed). While morphed, lose fire immunity on body part.

3PT: Melt a head into water.

4PT: Melt an arm into water.

12PT: Melt entire body into water. Can also move up to [6u] before returning to normal (even out of turn). You can move along any surface, even vertical or upside-down surfaces. All Opportunities made against you due to your movement must roll against your initial Dodge of [175]. This move may be used additional times in succession for [4PT] more each time if you are obstructed.

Craft Gift

48 hours

Craft an item suited to your friend’s needs based on [Plot Points] they spend. See Korl Treasure in the Green Book. Can only use if you’ve been freed.

Insight2

4PT & 10SN

Know all characters’ total WE, level, Stats, current & max Vitality and limb health, MIT, and DUR. Also know all stored items in Mystical Storage and Mystical Bags as well as all item enchantments.

~Passives~

1PT may be used for free every turn for every arm you have with more than 0 health.

Appear as a statue if standing still, eyes closed. You revive and regenerate fully every 6 hours.

Huge: Attacks have +1 Melee Range.

Huge: Cannot use defenses against physical attacks from Small-sized and smaller entities. Some moves cost much more PT.

Can see +120 degrees per head. Gain an Opportunity if an opponent moves into melee range. Can use Shoot as an Opportunity if hit by a ranged attack. 1 Opportunity per turn per head.

Immune to Fire, take +100% damage from Shock, and double Trauma Effects from Cold.

Gain +2d20 counter to use on any maneuver for each turn that begins before yours.

*Nerve 70

Courage 105

Willpower 105

Little Ones

Little ones are an utterly grotesque gnarl of exposed sinew and pulsing, bleeding meat in the shape of a massively front-heavy quadruped with giant hands, similar in build to a gorilla (but larger). They have a disproportionately large neck, which starts shoulder width and ripples with every heartbeat. The head of the monster is the original host’s exposed brain and eyes, which are tiny and dangling from the top of the monster’s pyramid-shaped neck. At the base of the creature’s spine (where a tail might be) is instead the emptied sack of skin from the original host - all that is left of their now inside-out body.

Unkillable

Passive: 60 Alchemy

Analyze: 110 Alchemy

This monstrosity regenerates in seconds. Even comes back alive, closes wounds, regrows limbs!

Parasitic

Passive: 70 Alchemy

Analyze: 70 Alchemy

The disease is the result of a parasite, which you now know how to recognize as it gestates (while it is still larval). Gestation is 2-3 months.

Terminal

Passive: 80 Alchemy

Analyze: 80 Alchemy

The infection cannot be cured. It ends with the subject bursting inside-out and growing a beast.

“Evidence shows that the White One researched a ‘larval weapon’ but abandoned early trials.”

- Aaryahi Chakrabarti, Ancient Crimes and Early Golemics

Behavior

Little ones almost exclusively rampage once they are born, with virtually no regard for anything at all. They seem to be in a constant state of blinding rage and will maim and kill anything in their vicinity.

Habitat and Life

Little ones are birthed when their larval state congeals into a portal inside a person’s body.

Immediately the portal channels a hose of flesh from another realm into the body of the host, fusing with the host from the inside.

The pressure of the meat causes the host’s skull to burst open in a river of pulsing, bloody sinew. The brain and eyes of the host stick atop a long column of exposed flesh that grows and grows from the host’s gaping throat. Within seconds, arms and legs pop out from the mass of meat which then form digits. The resulting beast is a grown adult which can live for several days before shriveling and imploding back into the larva’s original portal. The host’s skin is all that remains.

Histories and Cultures

A laboratory of the White One was discovered and documented by an unnamed scholar thousands of years ago. The scholar Aaryahi Chakrabarti discovered this work and covered it across several chapters in her book on First Age (and pre-Dawn) illegal magics.

A ‘larval weapon’ is mentioned briefly and the description for theoretical practice fits closely. The lab filed the notes under “Test #88: Little Ones.”

Notes for Playing as

In a similar fashion to the Casityr, little ones should be reserved as an assassination attempt against very high level parties by sinister villains.

Killable

Passive: 100 Alchemy

Analyze: 130 Alchemy

A critical strike or a blow with maximum trauma on the neck briefly stops the beast’s regeneration.

Abominable

Passive: 120 Alchemy*

Analyze: 140 Alchemy

Someone or something created this heinous disease for a reason using alchemical forging.

Curable

Passive: 140 Alchemy

Analyze: 210 Alchemy

During gestation, the subject must ingest only raw demon blood for 3 days. Host has a 50% survival chance with [100 Toughness] but 5% if lower.

Dash2

5PT & 5SN, Once per Round

Move up to [15u]. This doesn’t use a Move counter.

Leap

1 Move

Jump up to [15u], [30u] if two Move counters have already been spent. May jump over/through units.

Squelch

10PT, 500 Stamina, & 20 Sanity

Damage: [30 Health + 4000 Stamina]

Info: Bodily Attack (ML+SM+SL), 6 Base PT

~Passives~

Abomination, Gory, Grotesque, Size Adv/Disadv., Nervous Detection

Revive and regenerate fully every turn unless your neck received a Critical Strike or Level 5 Trauma during the round previous.

Triple Trauma Effects, Crit on a roll of 76-100. Restore [5PT] if you deal a Wound to a target.

Anyone first witnessing you loses [4d20 Sanity].

Huge: Attacks have +1 Melee Range.

Huge: Cannot use defenses against physical attacks from Small-sized and smaller entities. Most moves cost much more PT.

Your exposed nerves heighten your awareness. You do not need eyes or ears to perceive anything.

Physique 180

Arm Muscle 250

Leg Muscle 250

Wellness 55

Med/Rest 90

Toughness 115

Grace 5

Balance/Steer 45

Dexterity 5

Missile/Thrown 5

Stealth 5

*Prowess 100

Agility 100

Hand to Hand 225

Weapon One 100

Weapon Two 100

Erudition 5

Alchemy Lore 5

Common Lore 5

Essence Lore 5

Nature Lore 5

Wits 5

Awareness 115

Craftiness 5

Inscription 5

Tactics 5

Prestige 5

Authority 90

Charisma 5

Nerve 100

Courage 160

Willpower 160

Nabinasks

Nabinasks are anthropods just longer than a hume is tall and that are flat, long, and scurry close to the ground. They look like a cross between a horned beetle and a centipede, covered in plated scales that run the length of their back and have what look like hooked, armored boots on the ends of each of their six feet. The two primary horns on their heads are wide and large, with a jagged edge on the interior. Their coloring is translucent and sandy but darkens and grows opaque when they are threatened.

Venomous

Passive: 10 Nature* and 10 Alchemy

Analyze: 40 Nature

A nabinask’s toxin, while not initially fatal, can compound with each strike and grow dangerous.

Weakest Early On

Passive: 20 Nature or 30 Alchemy

Analyze: 50 Nature

Adrenals fuel a nabinask’s armor, which gets stronger and darker when hit or as time goes on.

Grounded

Passive: 30 Nature or 50 Essence

Analyze: 60 Nature

Nabinasks can even grow tougher and more venomous if shocked. They are also immune to sandstorms due to a thick, clear layer of eye skin.

“Nabinasks, the dune menace. Every trader from Setrocania to Riden knows them too well.”

- Eoghan Scrivener, On Creatures

Behavior

Nabinasks are a mid-range predator, meaning they are prey to some but still mostly dangerous to all. Because of this, they tend to lie low and still near rocky outcrops in large numbers waiting for travelers or smaller prey to come near.

Generally nabinask become fueled by the thrill of the hunt and can be quite aggressive as a swarm. If their swarm is dwindling in numbers or they are focusing their efforts, they will often scatter and regroup.

They tend to focus their venomous bites on only a few targets in an ambush and then scatter (guerilla style). This way when their targets die of toxins hours later, they can scavenge the corpse.

Habitat and Life

Nabinasks have been known to dwell anywhere there is sand. Their primary camouflage has allowed them to live safely in these environments. Even so nabinasks will often bring back corpses to their nests to pick and clean in safety, and as a result have been known to stockpile decent amounts of treasure unwittingly.

Nabinasks spawn their grubs from eggs, and guard their clutch closely. Grubs are quite quick and commonly members of hunting parties, even if their carapaces are still soft and developing.

Histories and Cultures

Cultures along the shores of Braven and in the Wasterly Desert universally regard nabinasks as a deadly and common pest of the sands. Even children are taught about the dangers of these beasts.

Notes for Playing as

Nabinask are meant to be annoying both in short or long fights but should be satisfying if adventurers can find their nest and get some loot.

Pick in Safety

Passive: 40 Nature or 60 Common

Analyze: 90 Nature

Nabinasks take corpses back to their nest to safely eat. This means their lairs may have treasure!

Slow Dilation

Passive: 50 Nature

Analyze: 100 Nature

Nabinasks are vulnerable to sudden bright lights, especially so at night or in the dark.

Weak to Enzymes

Passive: 70 Nature & 70 Alchemy

Analyze: 120 Nature

Entozune’s digestive enymes eliminate nabinask’s MIT if used with an attack. Rubbing enzymes on a wound also neutralizes nabinask venom.

Nabinask Grub

Level 8

Languages

Sand (3) & Therion (3)

Size: Small

Occupies: 1x1x1 (1u wide, 1u long, 1u tall)

Attack d100+70 (Bodily Attack)

Evade +40

Health 6

L Leg 1, 2, & 3

MIT 2 | 5%

Evade +40

Health 7

Flee2

1d6SN per Move

Move away from enemies. If moving closer to enemies: cannot take offensive action next turn.

Pincer Strike

6PT & 100Stam, Requires both Pincers

Damage: [12 Health + 3d20+25 Stamina]

Info: Bodily Attack (PU+BU), 6 Base PT

Effects: If this attack deals health damage, add 1 Toxin Stack. If you have been hit by an electric attack in the past round or if this is a sneak attack, dealt health damage adds 3 stacks instead.

Toxin: Each stack drains [50 Stamina] per round and adds [1 Bleeding]. Effect doubled if target has less than [30 Toughness]. Lasts 10 Rounds.

~Passives~

Adrenal Carapace, Ocular Epidermis

Every time a body part is hit it gains [2|5%] MIT. At the end of your turn MIT on every body part raises by [2|5%]. Max MIT is [10|25%]. Raising MIT darkens your body part, lowering Stealth in sand by [10] each stack. If you are struck anywhere by an electric attack, that body part gains max stacks. These effects last until combat ends. Note: MIT may be ignored if an attack received has Entozune enzyme on it or the body part receiving the attack is covered in enzyme.

Your eyes are protected from sand but dilate slowly. Sudden brightness has double the effect on you and lasts twice as long.

Mature Nabinask

Level 20

+1 Plot Point

Languages

Pincer Strike

6PT & 150Stam, Requires both Pincers

Damage: [18 Health + 4d20+125 Stamina]

Info: Bodily Attack (PU+BU), 6 Base PT

Effects: If this attack deals health damage, add 3 Toxin Stacks. If you have been hit by an electric attack in the past round or if this is a sneak attack, dealt health damage adds 5 stacks instead.

Toxin: Each stack drains [50 Stamina] per round and adds [1 Bleeding]. Effect doubled if target has less than [75 Toughness]. Lasts 10 Rounds.

~Passives~

Adrenal Carapace, Cowardly, Ocular Epidermis, Scrupulous

Every time a body part is hit it gains [5|15%] MIT. At the end of your turn MIT on every body part raises by [5|15%]. Max MIT is [25|75%]. Raising MIT darkens your body part, lowering Stealth in sand by [10] each stack. If you are struck anywhere by an electric attack, that body part gains max stacks. These effects last until combat ends. Note: MIT may be ignored if an attack received has Entozune enzyme on it or the body part receiving the attack is covered in enzyme.

Can use Move and Tactical Shift out of turn.

Your eyes are protected from sand but dilate slowly. Sudden brightness has double the effect on you and lasts twice as long.

If a fumble is rolled, crit instead.

Nature’s Domain

Nature’s domain is a special taxonomy of creatures that are not organized according to objective or external observation but rather a self-ordered taxonomy of different, co-existing species. Nature’s Domain refers to a large variety of mostly mundane creatures that to the novice seem unrelated. But for a scholar with advanced lore of Wyverns or the ordering and history of nature, all of these creatures are deeply connected. The following lore section will briefly describe each creature’s appearance and behavior. With the exception of the Wyvern, meeting the lore requirements of a given creature simply unlocks knowledge of the creatures active and passive abilities (which can be viewed on each of their stat pages). The final five Lore items in this section refer specifically to wyverns.

Note: The creature pages in this subsection are ordered alphabetically, unlike other subsections.

Peetle Bug

A beetle the size of a cat, very friendly and talkative. Can be spotted, iridescent, or matte of any colors. Created by alchemy as the “ideal” pet, they are often domesticated but sometimes found wild.

Passive: 10 Nature

Analyze: 40 Nature

Portola

Also a beetle, portolas are larger than peetle bugs but look very similar (probably the inspiration). They are mostly uninterested in their surroundings as they roll up corpses into piles to eat.

Passive: 10 Nature

Analyze: 40 Nature

Nark

Narks are talkative, feathered serpents about 1 unit in length with two large feathered antannae and looping, curled tails. Adders (female) are venomous but patient and have a mane of feathers. Gullings (male) are flying bipeds and are obnoxious.

Passive: 20 Nature

Analyze: 50 Nature

Biqua

Biqua are extremely fast but gentle flying mantises the size of a crow. They often carry mail for postal services and take deliveries seriously. They cannot speak but love hearing a good story.

Passive: 20 Nature

Analyze: 50 Nature

Grimlim

Grimlim are partially blind, gossiping moles. They mumble and chatter and can sometimes be heard from above ground. They often give unwarranted advice if they spot someone passing by.

Passive: 30 Nature

Analyze: 60 Nature

Gaffy

Gaffies are erratic, flightless, squawking fowl with many legs. They love getting spooked or excited but sometimes a leg will pop off. Their legs grow back in time, making them easy farm animals.

Passive: 30 Nature

Analyze: 60 Nature

Vimp

While “vampire imps” are a touch smaller than pixies, vimps have bigger tongues, eyes, and ears and suck non-human blood to survive. They are not demons, travel in groups, and love to laugh.

Passive: 30 Nature

Analyze: 60 Nature

Dwem

Dwems are fluffy, round, big-eyed creatures with fox-like faces, little smiles, and four thin, nearly hairless legs. They love soft-spoken and quiet people and seek them out to be pet by them. Dwem love being companions and having adventures.

Passive: 40 Nature

Analyze: 70 Nature

Kidler

Kidlers are amphibious cephalopods about the size of a pint of ale. They seek out dungeons, lairs, or traveling ships to find, make, and watch others solve puzzles. They love people and puzzles.

Passive: 40 Nature

Analyze: 90 Nature

Gokledos

Gokledai are tan or brown bi-pedal pack beasts with massive legs and no other limbs. They have flapping jowls, long tongues, and hydration sacs all over their belly and face. They love eating grass.

Passive: 40 Nature

Analyze: 90 Nature

Horton

Hortons are huge, short-furred hound dogs about the size of a hippo. They have incredible girth and rolling, excesses of skin which they can shed. They are domesticated for meat and leather production. Vimps are sometimes domesticated with Hortons, to encourage shedding and production. They seem to enjoy this mutual existence together.

Passive: 50 Nature

Analyze: 100 Nature

Oku

Oku are little quadrupeds shaped like onions or root tubers with two eyes and small mouths. They often have one or two large leaves on their heads and tiny, rootlike arms and legs. They talk with a squeak and often can be heard giggling from afar.

Passive: 70 Nature

Analyze: 120 Nature

Calorcifer

Calorcifers are silent, dancing creatures made of unmelting wax that will on very rare occasions appear in campfires or other large flames near to the ground. They don’t stay for long, but sometimes leave a small ball of wax once the fire goes out. Calorcifers are considered powerfully lucky.

Passive: 100 Nature

Analyze: 170 Nature

Wyverns once Existed

Passive: 140 Nature*

Analyze: (Cannot Analyze)

Old records claim wyverns had two beautiful feathered antennae and a mane of colorful feathers around their neck. They have two wings, two legs, no arms, are venomous, and have curling tails.

Wyvern Offspring

Passive: 170 Nature

Analyze: 240 Nature (on Narks)

No one has seen or recorded Nark reproduction. Based on this (as well as old records of Wyverns), it is possible that Narks are their offspring.

Wyvern’s Domain

Passive: 200 in Any One Lore

Analyze: (Cannot Analyze)

Once every few millennia a female nark adder will ascend and become a wyvern. Only wyvern can bear offspring and will set up territories to avoid interfering with other wyvern dominions.

Wyvern Collective

Passive: 250 Nature

Analyze: 300 Nature (on any Nature’s Domain member)

Wyvern have the ability to telepathically communicate with and listen to all creatures in Nature’s Domain within their territory. They can also scry through the eyes of any Nark offspring of theirs, up to dozens at a time. This all makes wyverns incredibly elusive beasts, shrouded in mystery.

Deepest Secrets

Passive: 300 in Any One Lore

Analyze: (Cannot Analyze)

Wyverns have unknown lifespans and can gain vast knowledge and secrets. Not only are they the reason that dragons survived the Great Trauma (by opening Dragon’s Drill, the gate to the underworld), but they also may have secrets from the days of the mirthics and time immemorial.

Notes for Playing as

What are wyverns after? What do they know exactly? Why are they so passive? This is up to you to decide (if at all). Honestly? Don’t worry about answers until your players get to campaigns that deal with things over level 60 on the regular.

So little is known about wyverns that they could have any sort of motives. However, the one thing that all wyverns care about is nature’s balance.

Braven is not a kind place. Many things are powerful, cruel, or difficult. Nature’s Domain is not really intended to be any of that! These creatures should add delight and mystery to an otherwise weary world of woe.

“Nature’s order has a content disregard for us. This appears ‘chaotic’ to those who don’t listen.”

- Yis’rit Vautbaum, Theologies and Philosophies of Nature

Biqua

Level 3

Languages

Therion (3), Sign-Language (2), & Choice (2)

Size: Tiny

Occupies: Less than 1x1x1.

Evade +50

Health 3

Accompany2

4PT & 1SN

You strum your mandibles together, creating a pleasant, melodic beat to match someone’s activity. (You create a musical addition to someone’s action, such as an attack, maneuver, or song.) The target cannot fumble on their next maneuver. They gain a [+25 bonus to Authority and Charisma] to use with their next maneuver or a follow-up to their next maneuver.

Tickle

6PT, max 3 uses per day

You swiftly and delicately tickle a target with both mandibles. The target may laugh uncontrollably if they trust you and your roll of [d100 + 65] exceeds their [Willpower + 50]. You heal [1SN] if the target laughs.

~Passives~

Winged

Can use Move in any direction and hold mid-air.

Calorcifer

Burn Dance

1 Minute & 5SN, One use per day

If you find and engulf yourself in intense heat (such as an open flame, lava, glowing embers, or heat vent), you may use Burn Dance. While using Burn Dance, all nearby targets heal [1SN] and take [6 Stun] every ten seconds for one minute (or every round for 6 rounds). During this time, anyone who has taken stun gains [+50] to casting Social Spells.

Wistful Wish

Only usable during Burn Dance

You hope that some future event will come to pass. The more Plot Points are spent, the more likely it is to succeed (pending Host approval). Anyone you have stunned may join you in this ability. A Wish may only be made if everyone participating hopes for the same thing. No one is allowed to speak and must finish wishing before your Dance ends.

If the ritual succeds: You add two Plot Points to the Wish for every participant that spent at least one Plot Point. Your body hardens and you become a small, inanimate lump of wax. At least one participant must take you with them in order for the Plot Points you granted to actually take effect. Whenever the Wish comes true, you reanimate and may go on your way.

~Passives~

Fire-lover, Mystical Fluidity, Waxling

Fire heals you equal to the damage they would have delt, Trauma included.

You may optionally use Dodge against any spell as if it were Flung. Nerve is your Stat for Agility. You can read minds and know Wishes.

When you use Dodge, you can melt yourself into a fast-moving liquid. You gain [+100] to Struggle and any target attempting to grab or hold you must use their Dexterity in place of their Muscle.

Attack (No Attacks)

Defense 200 (=PT, Dodge, can use for Resist)

S. Resist 172 (See: Dodge), Lore Type: Nature

Move 6/1, +2 INI 10 PT 18

Stam 1500 SN 350,+10 DH 50

Radiate2

10PT, Optional: +3SN

Your eyes and fur shine brilliantly. You become irresistibly cute and cannot be directly targeted by an attack until the end of your next turn.

Precious Gaze: If [3SN] more was spent, you may choose a target to gaze at that must be capable of seeing you. They will meet your gaze with theirs, taking [1d3 Stun] but healing [2SN]. Precious Gaze may only be used once per target per day.

Tag Along2

2SN & Costs of other abilities

If any Fay uses Evanesce and is touching you (such as a wisp riding you as a mount or you sitting in a middron’s fanny pack), you may mimic the effects of their Evanesce and also gain any movement abilities and benefits the Fay has while Evanesced. You must spend costs equal to Evanesce and any movement skills you gain (if you use them).

~Passives~

Adaptive Underfur, Fayfriend

You have [+100] to Hot and Cold environmental effects due to your fur.

Fay you trust gain [+2SN] regen per day as long as you are with them.

Health 6

Scratch

5PT

Damage: [5 Health + 3d20+115 Stamina]

Info: Bodily Attack (SL), 5 Base PT

Detach2

Triggered, one use per round

If you have at least two legs and fail a Courage maneuver or use Flee, you detach one leg onto the ground, removing it from your body and your control. The leg violently flails and will use Scratch on any target that moves onto the unit it occupies for [1d3] turns. The attack will randomly target whichever body part is closest to the ground with an attack maneuver of [d100+50]. After that, the leg becomes inanimate. Using Detach heals you [d20+100 Stamina] and [1 Sanity]

Flee2

1d6SN per Move

Move away from enemies. If moving closer to enemies: cannot take offensive action next turn.

~Passives~

Adrenaline Junkie, Pathetic Wings, Regenerative Adaptation

You don’t lose Sanity from failed Courage checks.

Can use Jump for the same cost as Move.

*You grow 1 leg per week and start with 2d3 legs. You can have 6 legs maximum.

Gokledos

Adrenal Pop2

3SN, Triggered

If you get hurt, scared, or become overwhemingly excited, one of your liquid sacs burst. All targets within [5u] radius lose [1SN] and [+10] is added to their Fumble chance for 1 Round. This may stack.

Jowl Fixation2

15PT and 2SN

You place the lips of your floppy jowls on a target.

If on a character: You learn their Level and Stats.

If on an item: You learn whether or not it contains magic and if it has a trigger glyph on it.

If on the ground: You have a high chance of finding water and may extend your strawlike tongue into the ground up to [8u] to store the moisture.

~Passives~

Amenable Wardrobe, Dense, Grass Addict, Jowly, Sac Storage

In 8 hours your coat can grow in or shed depending on the climate you are in, granting up to +100 to Cold and +50 to Hot environments.

You calculate Physique, Grace, INI, PT costs, and Knockback/Knockdown received as if you were Immense. Your Max Carry is also tripled.

Any day you eat grass you gain up to [+3SN Regen]. If you go 24 hours or more without eating grass all Med/Rest maneuvers receive [-50].

Your jowls cannot trigger touch spells.

Your tongue is [8u] long and you can store [20] rations of water in your liquid sacs, which you consume by absorbing. (Others cannot drink this.)

Attack (No Attacks)

Defense (Gokledai do not Defend)

S. Resist 95, Lore Type: Nature

Move 9/5 INI -15 PT 15

Stam 1400 SN 15 DH 90

Head

MIT 0 | 10%

Evade +10

Health 25

R Leg

MIT 0 | 10%

Health 120

Grimlim

MIT 0 | 0%

Evade +30

Health 12

Burrow/Unburrow

3 uses of Move

Burrow: If soil is directly below your head, you may burrow into the ground. While burrowed, your MIT rises by [25|50%] and Stealth by [d100]. You may use burrow again to go deeper and become completely untargetable and untrackable (except via spells), but you must use Unburrow twice to surface instead of just once.

Unburrow: As long as only soil is above you, you may rise towards the surface. Unburrow must be used an equal number of times as Burrow was used in order to rise to the surface.

Feedback2

3PT & 1SN, Once per target per turn

The target’s fumble and critical chance are doubled for their next maneuver. This may be used if you have burrowed only once.

~Passives~

Eartheared, Poor Sight, Soilswimmer

Can sense movement on any earth or stone adjacent to you within [1000u] while you are burrowed. You can hear as normal while burrowed.

You have [-50 to Perception] when only sight is required, but take no disadvantages from sight-related negatives.

Can move underground with no disadvantages.

Bay2

9PT & 20SN, One use per day

You howl. All targets that hear you cannot critically strike for 1 Round.

Plead2

6PT & 6SN

Roll [d100+6d20+5] against target’s [Willpower + 50] to force them to attack no other targets but you for 1 round.

Shed2

9PT & 12SN, Limited use

You shed your skin and completely restore all health to your limbs in the process. You may only use this ability if one of the two following requirements are met: You have not used Shed in the last 7 days or every one of your limbs has taken some health damage.

~Passives~

Platonic Masochist, Self-coagulating, Size Disadvantage

You heal [2SN] for every [1 Health Damage] a limb receives. This does not apply to Health lost from Bleeding or damage directly to Death Health.

Bleeding you receive only lasts for 1 Round. For every PT you do not use, you heal [50 Stamina].

Huge: Most moves cost much more PT.

Kidler

Devise Puzzle2

1-4 Hours, depending on complexity

You create a fun and harmless puzzle for some unwitting folks to discover. If your puzzle is solved, you heal [5SN] and may use Reward.

Some examples: aligning shapes, sorting objects, imitating symbols, creating a pattern, tidying a space, or mimicing beats or melodies using objects as instruments. Think in terms of using gestalt, visual-thinking games for sighted puzzles that use symmetry, proximity, similarity, enclosure, continuitity or hue. For auditory puzzles try to think in terms of pitch, tone, tempo, or melodies and get characters to imitate or create tunes. Other fun puzzles might include improvisational games involving back and forth dialogue via jokes or puns.

Reward2

Triggered, One use per day

If a character or characters have solved your puzzle, you may use Reward on them (at your discretion, you may choose not to as well). If the Host has prepared treasure or dangerous puzzles in the near future, you may give them some kind of tip related to it or just “good luck” (such as a Plot Point only for use with that treasure or puzzle). Otherwise, you may gift the character or characters with Kidler Ink (see the Green Book for more).

~Passives~

Hydrophillic, Signs, Vertical Mastery

Can breathe water. Swim costs normal Move.

You leave occasional trails of ink and a strong smell of salt in the air anywhere you inhabit. These two traits are often used by adventurers to recognize your puzzles with a [90 Nature Lore Analyze].

Climbing costs normal Move. Can climb smooth surfaces, vertical and upside down and remain suspended using only 4 tentacles.

Nark Adder

Bite

3PT

Damage: [6 Health + d20+5 Stamina]

Info: Bite Attack (ML), 3 Base PT

Effects: If this attack deals Health Damage and your target’s [Toughness + 50] is less than your roll of [d100 + 40], your venom metabolises. Your venom coagulates their blood, removing or preventing up to [2d6 Bleeding] inflicted on the same limb for [3 Rounds]. The venom is painful and deals [40 Stamina] damage each round it is active. This can compound, stacking and refreshing the [3 Round] duration each time this venom metabolises again on the same target.

Gossip2

3PT, Optional: 30Min

If a target you trust shares a secret with you, you may share a secret with them of equal value (if you have one to share).

Bond: if your target uses Rest, you may Rest with them for [30min]. You spend your time together chatting and sharing pleasant conversation. You may offer them earnest advice and encouragement if they ask for it. Your target heals [1d6SN].

Oku

Dissipate2

Free to use, even after death

You instantly disintegrate yourself into a puff of smoky spores. This kills you, but it warns all members of Nature’s Domain, fay, koda, and any Environmental Essence (Godless) within [500u] of danger. If any Oku were connected to you due to their own Giggle, they each take [5SN Damage].

Giggle2

3PT, May be restricted

You giggle. Nearby Oku within hearing range are pleased and heal [1SN] (only applies once per day). When you giggle, you form a neural bond with all other Oku in hearing range and can sense what they sense as if you were with them. This effect lasts 2 minutes. You cannot giggle for 5 minutes after using Point.

Point2

3PT, One use per day

When asked a question by someone you trust, you may only answer by pointing. However, you must always do your best to be truthful and helpful.

Renew2

1 Hour & 20SN

If you acquire spores from another Oku, you can plant them deep in the earth in order to create sporelings. Sporelings grow into Oku after one week and may gain the memories of their parent.

~Passives~

Floral, To each according to their need

You do not need to eat (you only require water).

All Oku you connect to with your Giggle share a bond. You all share Sanity and Stamina, dividing any damage or loss taken by one among all of you.

Portola

Release Bouquet

6PT

Release a pleasant smelling opium cloud. All nearby non-Portola targets in a [5u] radius lose [10% Stamina] and heal [1SN]. If a target has less than [40 Med/Rest or 40 Willpower], they lose [20% Stamina] instead. No roll is made. This cannot be mitigated by armor or deal trauma. Once a target is unconscious, they no longer heal Sanity.

~Passives~

Composter, Pack Mule, Salvific Saliva

Inanimate flesh (corpses and meats) continually exposed to your Bouquet will decompose completely into carbon in 24 hours.

Arm and Leg Muscle maneuvers are tripled when used to calculate encumbrance or lift or move anything.

Your saliva coating your mouth and tongue protects you from all diseases, toxins, venoms, and ailments that are transmitted via touch, airborne, or ingestion. It also completely sanitizes anything it touches.

Vimp

Cackle2

4PT, Triggered, one use per day

If a stranger tells you a joke that you genuinely find funny or you hear another vimp use Cackle, you will let out a powerful laugh. All other vimps within hearing range heal [2 Sanity] and can also use Cackle.

Euphoric Bite

10SN

Deal [5 Health] damage to a sleeping, non-human target but heal the target [5 Sanity] and grant them [+25] to their current Sleep maneuver. This does not deal trauma damage and does not require a roll for attack. You have consumed your required food and water for a day.

Release Jelly2

Once per day

You release a portion of sweet jelly from your tear ducts when you use Sleep. If consumed, this Jelly heals its target [1 Sanity]. If Cackle was used since your last Sleep, two portions of Jelly are released. Unless preserved or used, the Jelly expires after 2 days.

Wyvern

Level 75

+35 Plot Points

The queen of nature and of all of the little things.

Naturalist Skollyson, “Archives from before the 1st Era.”

Languages

B’raeim (3), Colonial (3), Dark-Tongue (3), Old Nia (3), The Sea (3), Therion (3), & Choice (3x2)

Size: Large

Occupies: 4x7x14 (4u wide, 7u long, 14u tall)

Brilliant Shimmer2

15PT & 200SN

Any target that sees, hears, smells, or otherwise detects you for the next [24 hours] takes [4d6 Stun] and will forget encountering you if their [Willpower + 50] does not exceed your roll of [d100 + 300]. The target will forget as soon as they can no longer detect you. If any spell or method of recording is used to capture a sighting of you, anyone that witnesses it will also take stun and forget but use their [Craftiness + 50] instead of Willpower for a chance to resist.

Deepsight

15PT & 5 Plot Points

Using your mind, you know all the memories of all entities and objects and full details of all magic within [80u]. Entities may resist you using their [Courage + 50] against your roll of [d100 + 300].

Sting

12PT & 10 SN

Damage: [200 Health + 8d20+600 Stamina]

Info: Bite or Tail Attack (ML + SK), 6 Base PT

Effects: If this attack deals Health Damage and your target’s [Toughness + 50] is less than your roll of [d100 + 200], your venom metabolises. Your venom coagulates their blood, removing or preventing up to [3d6 Bleeding] inflicted on the same limb for [3 Rounds]. The venom is painful and deals [2400 Stamina] damage each round it is active. This can compound, stacking and refreshing the [3 Round] duration each time this venom metabolises again on the same target.

Attack (No Attack Rolls)

Defense (See Blank Slate)

S. Resist 315, Lore Type: Nature

Head

MIT 25 | 80%

Evade -40

Health 180

Chest

MIT 18 | 65%

Evade -50

Health 800

R Leg

MIT 18 | 65%

Evade -50

Health 700

Neck & Tail

MIT 18 | 65%

Evade -50

Health 1000

Wing 1&2

MIT 12 | 75%

Evade -50

Health 1800

L Leg

MIT 18 | 65%

Evade -50

Health 700

Move 21/6 INI 25 PT 36

Stam 15000 SN 600,+50 DH 475

Share

1 Minute, 5SN, & 1 Plot Point

You may share a 1 minute memory (including one from when you scried or another’s memory you have seen) with a target you trust. They may need to spend Plot Points, pending Host’s decision.

~Passives~

Angelic, Ascendancy, Domain, Size Adv/Disadv, Winged, Worldroot

Targets heal [15SN] when they first see you.

You can telepathically communicate and listen to any member of Nature’s domain, one at a time. You may scry up to 30 of your offspring at once.

You have a deep connection to all plant life and many creatures that live in an enormous area. You may choose to govern or let the sentient creatures of the region self-govern. It is up to you.

Immense: No attack roll is made. Instead, attacks have +2 Melee Range and will hit an entire unit. Attacks place randomly using glance table on each target occupying the unit unless targets use Block or are able to move from the unit.

Immense: Cannot use defenses against physical attacks from Medium-sized and smaller entities. Most moves cost considerably more PT.

Can use Move in any direction and hold mid-air.

If you die, all non-sentient plant life in your domain withers and dies. In death, you choose up to 12 ascendant-potentials from your Nark Adder children. All members of your domain must decide (in whichever way they see fit) which of these ascendant-potentials should ascend and take your place over your domain. (One must be chosen in order for plant life to return.)

Physique 75

Arm Muscle 75

Leg Muscle 75

Wellness 50

Dexterity 5

Missile/Thrown 5

Stealth 5
